page.title: 01Landscape Introduction Area
page.content: Bures is made up of the three different parishes of Mount Bures, Bures Hamlet and Bures St.Mary.Each is a small comnunity in a rural setting. Mount Bures is named after The Mount which is to be found next to the Norman church which goes back to 1066. Bures St. Mary and Bures Hamlet are the most populous and lie either side of the River Stour which forms the county boundary of Essex and Suffolk. Most of the farms in the area are arable and are widely spread in rolling countryside cut by the valley of the Stour and its tributary Cambridge Brook. There is one British Rail branch line running through the area from Marks Tey to Sudbury which is used by conmuters and people shopping in surrounding towns.
